text: today she's back in Dreghorn to meet old
friends I want to understand how Nicola
Sturgeon rose from our we air share
village to become one of the most
powerful women in Britain when we were
kids few people here voted SNP and I
should know my mom was a seasoned SNP
campaigner back then when she stood for
the SNP at the 1987 general election
Nicola Sturgeon turned up on our
doorstep she was 16 a knocked on our
front door one night June in the 1987
general election campaign and she came
to the door and I said something like
can I help your campaign with my name
and then she said yes come away in
Margaret Thatcher was on her way to a
third term as Prime Minister Nicola
Sturgeon burning hatred of Tory economic
policies drove her to action and it's
been driving her ever since yeah they
really can't work out what it was that
gave me the courage to do it because I
was she'll remember I was quite shy
young person maybe the black cord to
up the college to come here
I don't know I don't know where I got
that from but I'm glad I did
